message: I saw some of the live stream, but I didnt check a lot of sessions that I would have liked to have seen.  Does anyone know if the videos will be posted later?
I think they will be available when the postproduction has been finished.
that will be cool, I'll keep an eye on the blog i guess.  kinda wish the ustream was just archived.
I'd like that too! Could use another view of Idan Gazit's talk about Sass and Compass

we'll post the videos probably within two weeks, as @keimlink says: postproduction still needs to be done. And we do have a fair amount of material so that requires some time. We'll update the blog once the videos are available
Very nice, looking forward to rewatching some of that.
Not able to play this video http://ontwik.com/django/relax-your-project-with-couchdb/ Gets stuck after 4mins ...
Videos are up here: http://blip.tv/djangocon-europe-2011. It's really a shame (and difficult to understand) that their titles don't say what talk it is, only when and who.
This talk is not Alex Gaynor, but Jannis Leidel about Packaging http://blip.tv/djangocon-europe-2011/monday-1400-alex-gaynor-5309330
is there a chance to get mp4?

import urllib
import re
from BeautifulSoup import BeautifulStoneSoup

rss_feed = urllib.urlopen('http://blip.tv/djangocon-europe-2011/rss')
b_soup = BeautifulStoneSoup(rss_feed)

mp4_urls = []

for item in b_soup.findAll('item'):
  url = item.find('enclosure').attrs[2][1]
  mp4_urls.append(url)

#Removing duplicates
url_list = list(set(mp4_urls))
for url in url_list:
  print url
@elg0nz good idea... I miss the titles of the talks, so I've written a script that looks them up in the schedule and downloads both video and slides:  https://bitbucket.org/charstring/djangocon-talks
